channel.title: The world will end at anytime?
channel.description:
SCIENTISTS are trying to stop the most powerful experiment ever – saying the black holes it will create could destroy the world. Dubbed by some the Doomsday test, it will be carried out next week in the Large Hadron Collider (LHC), located 300ft underground near the French-Swiss border. The machine is 17 miles long and cost £4.4billion to create. When its switch is pulled on September 10, this atom-smasher will become a virtual time machine, revealing what happened when the universe came into existence 14 billion years ago. New particles of matter are expected to be discovered, new dimensions found beyond the four known, as scientists re-create conditions in the first BILLIONTHS of a second after the Big Bang. The atom smasher ... the 17-mile-long machine that some fear will destroy our planet The atom smasher ... the 17-mile-long machine that some fear will destroy our planet Experts even predict that millions of tiny black holes will be produced — baby brothers of the monsters gobbling up dust and stars at the heart of the galaxies.
[url=http://"http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/article1630897.ece"]Link.[/url] Coming from [The Sun] I thinks it's bullshit. Discuss

item.title: The world will end at anytime?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote="`Worx, post:139, topic:229842"][quote author=Frell link=topic=302455.msg2496633#msg2496633 date=1224435474]

What about that huge volcano in America that is due an eruption.

It will cover the entire planet in ash, dust and other molten shit if it erupts.

So, yes we could die at anytime.

Thats like uberlyimpossible lulz. Thats not a large amount of ash to cover the world so its hard to believe.
[/quote]

No it’s not. There is a large volcano in North America, in Yellowstone called “Old faithful”. It is supposed to erupt like every 100m years and we’re like 50,000 years behind schedule or something so it’s expected to erupt anytime. But is it likely? Who’s to say.[/quote]Old faithful is a geyser.

Read full topic
item.source: The world will end at anytime?

item.title: The world will end at anytime?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote="`Worx, post:139, topic:229842"][quote author=Frell link=topic=302455.msg2496633#msg2496633 date=1224435474]

What about that huge volcano in America that is due an eruption.

It will cover the entire planet in ash, dust and other molten shit if it erupts.

So, yes we could die at anytime.

Thats like uberlyimpossible lulz. Thats not a large amount of ash to cover the world so its hard to believe.
[/quote]

No it’s not. There is a large volcano in North America, in Yellowstone called “Old faithful”. It is supposed to erupt like every 100m years and we’re like 50,000 years behind schedule or something so it’s expected to erupt anytime. But is it likely? Who’s to say.[/quote]

I would tell you that you need to die, but I think some staffers might frown on that. The Geyser at Yellowstone National Park is called Old Faithful, and it erupts at certain times depending on the length time the geyser erupts. The geyser erupts because of the super volcano beneath it, creating heat and pressure in the water reservoir causing it to erupt for whatever length of time based on the amount of water that is in the reservoir.

There is no volcano in Yellowstone National Park called Old Faithful.

Read full topic

So, yes we could die at anytime.
[/quote]
Thats like uberlyimpossible lulz. Thats not a large amount of ash to cover the world so its hard to believe.[/quote]

No it’s not. There is a large volcano in North America, in Yellowstone called “Old faithful”. It is supposed to erupt like every 100m years and we’re like 50,000 years behind schedule or something so it’s expected to erupt anytime. But is it likely? Who’s to say.

item.title: The world will end at anytime?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:233623”][quote author=Cruzer link=topic=302455.msg2463046#msg2463046 date=1222569491]

seriously would be funny if they dont make a blackhole but space it self… pretty much like using a eraser tool in mspaint…

then sooner or later all the oxygen in earth will be rushing into that space area because space is a vacuum?

Even if the blackhole is as tiny as a peice of rice it as a vacuum cleaner it would be sinking in all the air around it unless they somehow put a vacuum container over it which would possibly neutralize it or it’s effects for the time being…

but if space is really a transformer which would transforms molecules such as oxygen into more space then they have to keep it contained if a leak happens it might be too late to stop it will be growing and growing until either the world runs out of air which is unlikely because trees keep making it… I don’t think it would be able to suck in objects such as people/houses/cars because if astronauts don’t get sinked in when they go into space that proves the theory is bogus and its only hunger is after stuff that flys like air/hydrogen/nitrogen. But im basing a blackhole on space it self which is my theory so i could be completely wrong.

Either way containment should be in control of military not civilians they should have military man at let protecting the perimeter around the 17 mile facility against arabic suicide bombers who want to get to allah faster or something if they bomb a crack in it that could be what causes the demise of earth.

As I said if air is the hunger is what these new particles crave then it be too risky… who knows if it even is possible to stop a blackhole from unforming… I believe the only way to unform one before it grows exponentially is uncreate the universe and so much shit in the universe … and nothing lowered the growth of space only increased it only our atmosphere is protecting us from it’s effects.
[/quote]This is why I support abortion.

This is why I support abortion.

This is why I don’t support homosexual rights.[/quote]lol owned

back on topic guise

Read full topic
